titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Caroline McCormick Slade (1874-1951) attended Bryn Mawr College as a graduate student in history and political science from 1892-1894. She was active in the women's suffrage movement, politics, and philanthropy. She was chairman of the Women's Division of the War Personnel Board of the YMCA (1917-1919), one of the founders of the League of Women Voters, Campaign Chairman of the National Woman's Committee for the Election of Herbert Hoover in 1928, and Vice-Chairman of the United Service Organizations during World War II. She was National Chairman of the Bryn Mawr Endowment Fund Campaign and served on the college's Board of Directors for more than 30 years.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of scrapbooks of Caroline McCormick Slade. Scrapbooks contain newspaper clippings, letters, telegrams, announcements, and programs related to her political work and her philanthropic endeavors. Notable correspondents include Herbert Hoover and Carrie Chapman Catt. The collection also includes a small batch of congratulatory letters for her work on the Endowment Fund Campaign.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
